bibl.title: Letter from W.S. Lemon to Philip Showalter Hench, July 31, 1937

div1.p: Lemon informs Hench of the honorarium offered to speakers by Sigma Xi and asks him to inform Moran that Sigma Xi will take care of him during his visit.

div1.head: Letter from W.S. Lemon to Philip Showalter Hench, July 31, 1937
div1.p:
It has been the custom of our chapter of Sigma Xi
to give a small honorarium to the speakers who appear during
the year. This usually is in the neighborhood of from $25 to
$60, the latter figure, I understand, being the largest that
has been given. I know that a good many people might think
that the Mayo Clinic was sponsoring the lectures and might
expect more, but in as much as this is entirely independent I
do not believe that we ought to promise a figure above the
amounts mentioned.

I should be glad if you would write Mr. Moran
that we would be glad to take care of him when he is here and
to give him a small honorarium.
